title: Samara Weaving to play Scarlett in GI Joe movie spinoff: Snake Eyes, with Crazy Rich Asians star
text:
Samara Weaving is the latest Aussie star to get a big break in Hollywood.

The former Home and Away star has signed on to play Scarlett in Paramount’s G.I. Joe film series spin-off, Snake Eyes, alongside Crazy Rich Asians star, Henry Golding.

It comes after her latest film Ready or Not made an incredible $48 million return out of a $6 million budget.

Big break: Samara Weaving has signed on to play Scarlett in Paramount’s G.I. Joe film series spin-off, Snake Eyes, alongside Crazy Rich Asians star, Henry Golding

The 27-year-old Adelaide born actress was incredibly excited to announced the news, sharing a related article on her Instagram page.

'Gotta get some muscles now,' she captioned the post.

Writer Alex Winter, who worked with Samara and Keanu Reeves in the upcoming Bill and Ted 3, also offered his congratulations to the actress.

She's a money maker: It comes after her latest film Ready or Not made an incredible $48 million return out of a $6 million budget

Samara has several family connections to the film industry with her uncle Hugo Weaving the most notable.

The young star recently featured in the Australian drama series picnic at Hanging Rock and starred in the slasher film, The Baby Sitter.

And last month, she joined her Guns Akimbo co-star Daniel Radcliffe at the premiere of their new flick at the Toronto International Film Festival in Canada.

Their film centres around a man who has to save his ex from kidnappers.

It runs in the family: Samara has several family connections to the film industry with her uncle Hugo Weaving the most notable

Speaking to MTV News about working together, Samara admitted she tried to keep her Deathly Hallows tattoo hidden from Harry Potter star Daniel, 30, while on set.

'I wore really long socks for a long time and then I realised what a gentlemen he is and I forgot to wear long socks,' Samara said.

'And yeah, he sort of [said], "Is that what I think it is?"

Daniel replied: 'It's what a lot of people have. There's no shame in it. There's not. It's absolutely okay. I wasn't gonna be like, "oh god, Samara, you clearly are a big fan. I'm freaked out by it."
description: Samara Weaving is the latest Aussie star to get a big break in Hollywood.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
